list_definition.definition: a bent pipe or tube through which liquid can be drawn off from one container to another at a lower level

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: He used a siphon to get some petrol out of the car’s tank.

list_definition.definition: (also soda-siphon) a glass bottle with such a tube, used for soda water.
(with off, into etc) to draw (off) through a siphon

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: They siphoned the petrol into a can.

list_ex_of_english: A fraud is being committed if money donated for charitable purposes by the public—either directly or through taxation—is siphoned off to pay for political campaigns.
We have seen special needs money siphoned off for other uses, fewer resources and larger classes.
On top of that, we have ensured that money goes straight to schools and is not siphoned off.
I observe only that this is yet one further example of detailed provisions being siphoned off into the rules, which we have yet to see.
The surcharge is simply a siphoning off of purchasing power.
Until we do that, all we shall do is to pump in money which is siphoned away because the regional economy is not basically healthy.
There is no way of siphoning it off for other purposes.
Their life blood—their taxation powers—will be less than would otherwise be the case because it will automatically be siphoned off, away from these shores.
